content: base of the palm to the tip of the middle finger stop the repeats on either row 5 or row 8 when you reach the height you like some possible recommendations for size please measure and stop when your hat is tall enough ​ newborn to baby repeat row 3 - 8 until the hat is around 4 high toddler repeat row 3 - 8 until the hat is around 5 tall child repeat row 3 - 8 until the hat is around 6 tall adult small repeat row 3 - 8 until the hat is around 7 tall adult repeat row 3 - 8 until the hat is around 7 5 tall © 2020 susan plack page 2 large adult repeat row 3 - 8 until the hat is around 8 tall or until the hat is as tall as you want if you like a shorter hat you can stop after any 3 row repeat yes you can stop in the middle of the brick repeats if you need to for height crown decreases this crown decrease adds about 2 25 to the top of the hat row 1 * k4 p2tog repeat to the end of the round row 2 knit row 3 * k3 p2tog repeat from * to the end of the round row 4 knit row 5 * k2 p2tog repeat from * to the end of the round row 6 knit row 7 * k1 p2tog repeat from * to the end of the round row 8 knit row 9 * k2tog repeat to the end of the round row 10 knit for larger sizes continue row 9 and 10 until you have 12 to 18 stitches at the top of the hat depending on the size you started with finish with 2 row of p2tog for all stitches depending on which size you are knitting you might p2tog with one stitch at the end of the first row and a second stitch at the beginning of the second row just keep going with the p2tog until you have somewhere between 6 to 8 stitches left cut the yarn with a 10 inch tail thread yarn through the remaining stitches pull tight and sew in the ends you are done note - pattern was updated in march of 2021 © 2020 susan plack page 3
